metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7401 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect interaction of the parse_packet() and parse_part_sign_sha256() functions in network.c in collectd 5.7.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) of a collectd instance (configured with "SecurityLevel None" and with empty "AuthFile" options) via a crafted UDP packet. It was discovered that collectd mishandles certain malformed network packets. A remote attacker could use this vulnerablity to cause a Denial of Service or consume system resources.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

collectd - 5.5.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
collectd-core - 5.5.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
collectd-utils - 5.5.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libcollectdclient1 - 5.5.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: collectd package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
